newsitem.title: UK: FTSE 100 opens mixed, firm gilts mitigate Dow.
newsitem.headline: FTSE 100 opens mixed, firm gilts mitigate Dow.

text.p: Bids and an absence of selling pressure wiped away pre-market losses on the FTSE 100 on Friday and firmer gilts quashed the effect of a weaker close to Wall Street, dealers said.
By 0745 GMT the index was 18.9 points up at 4,670.7, just 50 points short of its all time high.
"It's a sellers strike. It's all bids. Everytime the market-makers sell something there's just nowhere to go and get it back," said a senior dealer.
Defence stocks were the big corporate feature with GKN boosted by a court ruling and others rose as fears eased of a tougher UK government line on military exports.
